title.narrative: Partnerships for a Tolerant Inclusive Bangladesh (PTIB) Second phase, 2020

description.narrative: This project funding under the 2020 LGA frame is with the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is to contribute to a more tolerant and inclusive Bangladesh. It aims to deliver the result of ‘‘A community of more knowledgeable and active citizens, civil society groups, and policymakers who better understand and are more committed to promoting diversity, inclusion, and tolerance in Bangladesh’’. The project focuses on research to better understand the nature of disinformation, hate speech, and violent extremism in Bangladesh. It uses a data-driven and iterative process in citizen engagement activities. It also supports coordination, cooperation, and interaction with the Government. The project has three outcomes: • Output 1 – Research Facility: Improved knowledge, understanding, and insights into the drivers of conflict, violence, and extremism and build capacity to analyse the sources and nature of disinformation, exclusion, and intolerance in Bangladesh. • Output 2 – Citizen Engagement: Expanded diversity in the messages, messengers, and use of available media in promoting inclusivity and tolerance in Bangladeshi communities through online and offline engagement activities. • Output 3 – Government Engagement: Promote active coordination, cooperation, and interaction with the Government of Bangladesh to inform their efforts to strengthen inclusivity and tolerance and prevent violent extremism.
